meanings.definition: Divided into two branches or forks.
meanings.sent1: The bisulcate tree had two main branches reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed around the bisulcate rock formation, splitting into two streams.
meanings.sent3: The bisulcate road sign confused the travelers, making them wonder which way to go.
meanings.sent4: Her bisulcate decision led her down two different paths in life.
meanings.sent5: The bisulcate mountain range stood majestically, with two distinct peaks.

meanings.sent1: The bisulcate ruler had two indented lines for precise measurements.
meanings.sent2: The bisulcate tire tracks in the mud showed where the vehicle had passed.
meanings.sent3: The bisulcate pattern on the fabric resembled a smiling face.
meanings.sent4: His bisulcate handwriting made it challenging to read his notes.
meanings.sent5: The bisulcate canyon walls were marked with two deep grooves from years of erosion.
